step1.title: Raw vermiculite extraction

step2.title: Sorting and cleaning

step4.title: Heating and expansion

step5.title: Packaging and quality control

whatIsVermiculite.title: What is vermiculite?
whatIsVermiculite.description1: Vermiculite is a natural mineral that, when heated, expands into lightweight, accordion-like particles. This unique expansion process gives the material excellent insulating, water-retention and lightweight properties.
whatIsVermiculite.description2: The expanded structure of vermiculite provides a large surface area, making it ideal for thermal insulation, moisture retention and as a lightweight aggregate. It is inert, non-toxic and fire-resistant, suitable for construction, agriculture and industrial applications.

applications.title: Industrial applications
applications.subtitle: Discover how vermiculite performs across different sectors

items.title: Construction
items.description: Used as a lightweight aggregate in concrete, insulating boards, and roofing materials. Provides excellent thermal insulation and reduces structural load.

items.title: Agriculture and horticulture
items.description: Improves soil structure: enhances aeration, moisture retention, and nutrient availability. Used in seed mixes, hydroponics and greenhouses.

items.title: Insulation
items.description: Excellent thermal insulation for buildings, industrial equipment and high-temperature applications.

items.title: Fireproof materials
items.description: An important component in fire protection systems, fire-resistant panels, doors and coatings.

items.title: Metallurgy and industry
items.description: Used in casting, metalworking and high-temperature insulation. Protects equipment and enables safer handling of molten materials.

items.title: Filtration and absorbents
items.description: An effective filtration and absorbent material for liquids and gases.

items.title: Lightweight
items.desc: Very low density, which reduces structural load and simplifies handling.

items.title: Fire resistance
items.desc: Non-combustible material with melting point above 1100°C.

items.title: Thermal insulation
items.desc: Excellent insulating properties reduce heat transfer and improve energy efficiency.

items.title: Water retention
items.desc: Can retain 3–4 times its weight in water, making it ideal for horticulture and agriculture.

items.title: Chemical inertness
items.desc: pH-neutral and non-reactive, safe for plants, animals and sensitive materials.
